title: Steraks on melee only is unfairly nerfing proper itemization on three specific cases
body:
Hey guys, while I understand that on certain adcs steraks is being abused I would like to state that there are three champions in the fighter category who are negatively impacted by this change

the first champion that comes to mind is of course urgot, of which this is considered a core build item, while the champion could be effective without it He would lose a slot of AD+HP itemization which would force him into a much squishier role or would cut his damage, steraks is a very central part of the general urgot build


The second would be gnar, who also finds this item to be core on many builds, it is important for his mega form but making it useless on his ranged form would be quite frankly very negative on a champion who isn't overpowered. 

Finally, we have a bit more of an outlying case, the case for intended jayce. Jayce was orginally intended to be a bruiser champion, more of a triforce user, and someone who uses more of his melee kit than he currently does. While it is more common to see a jayce who plays the game running double or triple lethality, this build is actually a non-intended build that works as a side effect of Lethality itemization. While it is powerful on him I am generally convinced that riot will eventually target lethality on jayce for its fairly negative impact on gameplay, at which point he will naturally fall back on his bruiser gameplay style IF it still exists. Bruiser jayce is a significantly more balanced and well rounded approach to the champion but items like steraks would be core on him in that regard



While the item needs to be hit from the perspective of certain marksmen I don't see the restrictions needing to hit these three champions, as they all benefit from the item in a healthy way and use it as intended

none of the champions even buy the item. jayce definitely doesnt, gnar doesnt even buy it as a situational item apparantly, and urgot has other options.

whats the point in catering to champions with an item that they dont even want?
OP clearly has not made a good analysis of the current gamestate, proven by what he's said.

steraks isnt intended as a safety net for ranged champions who failed at kiting. that includes mini gnar and cannon jayce.

these forms are supposed to be more vulnerable in exchange for the extended range (and mobility in gnars case). especially gnars vulnerability in ranged form is supposed to counter balance the massive power boost he receives in mega form, and is supposed to create a window of weakness.


steraks is an item that was specifically made for melee champions to survive burst damage in the thick of battle. when gnar and jayce are in ranged form, they dont need the extra protection, since they shouldnt be in the middle of a fight unless they made a mistake got caught out of position.

transformation champions should still be able to benefit from steraks passive in their melee forms, which means making steraks melee only is entirely fair. mega gnar and hammer jayce would still benefit from the item as any other melee champion.

and even in ranged form, gnar and jayce get the extra ad and health. its only the passive that wouldnt trigger.

Gnar, jayce and urgot should be building this item, along with a phage item

they should all be building hp+damage which would lower jayce's damage anyways due to the itemization that allows this

The issue is that there isn't much stick, while im not against having reduced effects while ranged, the item should not simply be disabled

gnar: his hp is lower in mini form and therefore he has reduced effect on the shield proc

Jayce:  His ranged form has reduced armor and magic resist, and in bruiser build where he would actually be building this,, the damage on his ranged form is actually already significantly lower anyways, so there is literally zero issue with the item on him

urgot: this item was made for shit like urgot, who is classified roughly as a juggernaut.

The item on jayce and gnar is generally more for their melee forms anyways because of its value, however an actually good jayce (Not just a good player who happens to be rolling jayce at the moment) will not generally be in only once stance the entire time because a good jayce knows all of his combos and that requires weaving in and out of a fight so the item is fine
